revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Blood and Animal Fluids: A Study on Color and Composition
tldr: The author, William Thomas Brande, examines the composition and properties of blood and other animal fluids, focusing on their color and chemical makeup. He compares the composition of chyle, lymph, and blood, analyzing the serum, coagulum, and coloring matter. Brande also investigates the potential use of blood coloring matter as a dye.
